alert.note: Alert for North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 05 at 6:29AM MDT until July 07 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS, AND UPPER RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE WITH DRY LIGHTNING... .A disturbance passing north of New Mexico will produce windy conditions, while humidities plummet below 15 percent in many locations, and high temperatures soar a few to 10 degrees above normal with a Haines Index of 6. In addition, enough elevated subtropical moisture is forecast to move northeastward over the area for gusty and dry thunderstorms to develop. The potential exists for LAL of 6. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau, North Central Mountains, and Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley Friday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph, except up to 50 mph in the mountains near the Colorado border. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 20 percent with the highest humidities above 8000 feet. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
